reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: apartments were very clean on arrival and maids changed towels daily and made bed daily.changed sheets twice a week and tidied apartment daily. found apartments very spacious good size bedroom and large sitting/dining room. kitchen not too small only thing missing was dishwasher and oven and freezer wasnt working. small balcony was nice with table and two chairs.shutter in bedroom was handy.nice bathroom and good shower in bath. tiny tv but good channels sky news cnn mtv vh1 all in english and two really good movie channels.13 floors in total 4 lifts.no airconditioning was a pain but you can rent a fan at reception.staff helpful. beach about 4 minutes stroll away most gorgeous beach ever.lovely cheap restaurants our fav was hollywood steakhouse and the sitting bull next door good for mexican.amazing ice cream parlour on main street. be prepared to be offered hash especially at night.plenty irish bars. nightclub babylone,loads of restaurants offering 2 course set menus for 6 90 euro.make sure you go to slide and splash and zoomarine and if you can go see the sand sculpture exhibition its brilliant.
reviews.title: young couple loved apartments close to beach

reviews.text: just back from a week long stay in the club amarillis apartment and cant fault it. located less than 5 minutes walk from the beach,shops & restaurants. apartments v.spacious and comfortable. really clean, maids came daily and changed towels and cleaned apartment & sheets provided twice weekly. all staff v.helpful.
reviews.title: would go again!
my favourite place
reviews.text: some road works nearby, but not too disruptive.
pool area and gardens very well maintained. lots of sunloungers available and well spaced out.
reviews.title: LOVED IT

reviews.text: indoor pool,sauna,jacuzzi & steam room in apartments, costing 10euros for 2 hours, or 24euro for 6 sessions.
reviews.title: Love Club Amarillis!!!! =]
It's an average "timeshare" but location is great
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here at the end of May. The hotel could use some upgrades. Nevertheless it's a no frills stay. We only used it to cook, shower and sleep, majority of our time was spent at the beach which was ~2 blocks away. There was no remote control but if you call downstairs, they will bring you one. Our kitchen had the basic cooking utensils but didn't have a blender or coffee maker and no scissors! Also, there's no laundry room in the building which I was lead to believe otherwise. There are local laundromats nearby but it's quite pricey. The supermarket to go to is Continente - it's in a mall and there's everything there (it's like a smaller version of a walmart or target back in the states but with plenty of fresh food). The wine section there is very good and the store is very organized and they also take credit cards which the nearby supermarkets don't accept credit cards that are not from portugal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort did not seem busy at all while we were there. Only occasionally did we see other guests. Our bedroom had twin beds so it was a bit uncomfortable. At night you do hear street noises or the gulls fighting or the dogs barking even though we are on the 10th floor.
reviews.title: Strongly recommendeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Any how, this is not much different from timeshares that we've stayed in Turkey, Canary Islands or Maui but definitely don't expect a great hotel. Also, there's internet in the lobby where you can buy an access code to use the wi-fi or desktop for 15 min, 30 min or an hour.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large roomy apartment, kitchen well-equipped (m/wave, toaster, kettle, ceramic hob, fridge). Staff very courteous and helpful (willingly moved us to a higher room, and sorted out problems with airport transfer).
reviews.title: Very Unfriendly Resort and Apartments

reviews.text: We are just back from Club Amarillis after a 2 week stay and to be honest we absolutely loved it from start to finish. The apartments themselves are huge with a large dining sitting area. Bathroom has a good mixer shower worked from the bath. The apartment was serviced everyday, and the women work incredibly hard in this area for very little money,so its good to be aware of this and be courteous to staff. The portuguese way of life moves at a slow pace so if you dont get served as quickly in shops or restaurants as you would at home, this is completely normal. It can be difficult to get used to at first but relax you're on holiday! The bar is nice provides some entertainment, but wouldnt be to everyones taste.
reviews.title: a nice easygoing place

reviews.text: Relaxing break after x mas.
reviews.title: quite january break

reviews.text: Good Great value for money. Child friendly. friendly staff.Good location near bars beach A great base from which to explore.
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.disliked: — No aircon although we hired a fan so it wasnt so bad

reviews.text: Taffys bar a must also baccas bar children made to feel at home family run bar you leave feeling like one of the family.This accomadation is good value for money. Every thing you need is at hand at no extra cost.Large apartments very clean well equiped I would recommend highly to everyone..
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in 2005 ans it was great the staff were good esp Bruno in the bar.
reviews.title: So-So

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The appartment was big great for us as we are a family of four. It was very clean and we got clean sheets and towels every day.
reviews.title: What a Holiday!!

likes.liked: — Size of apartment, attention to cleanliness of room, manners of staff

reviews.title: Praia da Rocha, activities, food and drink, club amarillis
reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from a two week stay in Praia da Rocha. We stayed in the very well located club Amarillis, just 100m from the main strip. However if we were to return again we would most likely book the Hotel Jupiter as it is a four star hotel at the center of everything. Club Amarillis served us well as we are both young and not picky about accomodation, but saying that i wouldn't send my parents to the same hotel as there is a slight hill on the walk to the main strip. other than that it was an extremely clean and well equiped hotel with friendly staff and a nice bar. we found the on site super-market very handy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Praia da Rocha itself has a wide variety of bars and restaurants. Food is cheap, average two course meal is ten euro and the local beer is approx three euro a pint. Imported alcohol is a little bit more expensive.
reviews.title: Clean but old, not so friendly staff.........

reviews.text: There is plenty to see and do while in Portugal. We done alot of day trips including Zoomarine (good family day out), 2.5hour cruise to see the cliffs and wild life (bring your sun screen) Fiesa sand scultures was interesting, a day trip to seville in spain, (even though its an early start-5.40am- its well worth the visit), Fatima and Lisbon as an overnight tour was the highlight of our holiday. If your are booking any tours we recommend you book with Herataur on the main strip (across from "on the rocks" pub) and not with your tour operatour as it is alot cheaper and staff are very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Holiday in Club Amarilis
Great 'Hotel', not sure about resort
reviews.text: The beaches are out of this world! White sand and blue sea's. extremely clean and only draw back is the climb down and up from the beach - approx 80 steps.
Me & my boyfriend stayed here for 2 weeks in July, just back! The apartments are huge really spacious and the cleaner comes in every day and replaces towels and loo rolls.
reviews.title: Lovely spacious apartments but no evening entertainment
